Header: Views expressed on PC elections in Parliament
Content: Government as well as Opposition Parliamentarians and the Speaker expressed their views on the holding of the Provincial Council elections in Parliament today. Parliamentarian Dulles Alahappperuma said that if the Provincial Council election is being held before August the related amendments should be presented to Parliament immediately. If not the Commission will have to take judicial action. According to the order they do not see such an amendment being presented. Speaker Karu Jayasuriya said that Ministers Mano Ganeshan and Rauf Hakeem said that they had to make certain clarifications with the President. As such they sought the necessary time for this effort.
